primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in the 'vast primordial catastrophe' of human sin to redeem a people who are incapable of saving themselves through moral accounting.

tekstueel_bewijs: he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities
the purpose of an all-powerful Father to redeem his entire creation
he is a God of infinite mercy
with him there is plenteous redemption
The fear of the Lord is founded on his absolute goodness.

ontvanger.identificatie: Israel / The Human Race / The Hearer
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is explicitly moved from the role of 'Subject of their own salvation' to 'Receiver of mercy'.

helper.identificatie: The Word/Psalm 130/The Spirit (implied through the 'enabling' of confession)
tekstueel_bewijs: the Psalmist is enabled to raise up his eyes
helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; the Word is the Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help that enables internal honesty.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin as a Cosmic Power / The 'Impulse toward self-destruction' / Moralistic Record-keeping
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as a 'contagion' and 'primordial catastrophe' that renders the human 'Subject' totally incompetent.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer, having received mercy, acts as a 'watchman' for others and lives in 'fear of the Lord' (awe-filled obedience).
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Redeemed Person
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/witness) only begins once the primary program (redemption) has rendered the person 'enabled'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God loved in proportion as he forgave.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You are spending enormous amounts of psychic energy.

voorbeelden: things which we ought to have done (quoted as part of the problem of the old prayer book)
straining forward to the approach of the dawn
understand what is meant here by the fear of the Lord
total inability to present ourselves righteous
the Psalmist is enabled to raise up his eyes

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on human 'non-pouvoir' (inability) and God's 'pouvoir' (power to redeem). Grace is the endowment of competence to the incompetent.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S1 (the false security of moralism) to S2 (the reality of the record/judgment), then to ~S2 (the depths of confession), finally arriving at S1 (the surprise of mercy).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God 'not weighing merits' but 'pardoning offenses.'
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is taken with extreme seriousness; without the 'record' being real, mercy is trivialized.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon systematically dismantles the anthropocentric 'ledger' system and replaces it with a theocentric narrative of rescue.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we spend the rest of our lives uneasily trying to reassure ourselves and others that we have more credits than debits.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the sole active agent in redemption
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: he shall redeem Israel from all his iniquities

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Psalmist and Mr. Head are not models of virtue to imitate, but models of 'miserable offenders' who receive mercy.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the one who hears the cry from the depths.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'psychic energy' of self-justification; liberation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic salvation: God does the work, man receives the benefit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon maintains a strict hierarchy where the 'Fundamental Program' (God's mercy) always precedes and enables the 'Secondary Program' (human response).

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the less we deserve, the more merit is in his bounty

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit enables the 'honesty leading to deliverance'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical. Sin is a 'vast primordial catastrophe' and 'contagion'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a masterclass in theocentric narrative. It correctly identifies the human as the 'Receiver' and God as the 'Subject'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Sin) is already sufficiently cosmic.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon perfectly exemplifies the 'Grammar of Grace' by keeping God as the Subject of all transformative verbs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis might focus on the use of literary quotes (Auden, Shakespeare), Greimassian analysis reveals these quotes all serve to reinforce the 'incompetence' of the human Subject.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Hebrew of Psalm 130; semiotics shows how the sermon's structure mirrors the Psalm's movement from 'depths' to 'redemption'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas allows us to see that the 'ledger' system is actually a narrative 'Opponent' that prevents the hearer from becoming a 'Receiver' of grace.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses secular literature to establish the 'Opponent' (Sin) before introducing the 'Subject' (God).
